intro: Maerua, commonly known as the African thornapple, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Capparaceae. It consists of several species, many of which are shrubs or small trees native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and southern Asia. The plants are characterized by their spiny stems, small leaves, and yellow or white flowers that bloom in clusters. They are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to withstand drought conditions. Some species of Maerua have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
